title: Chef John's Cream of Asparagus Soup Recipe
description: This ultra-easy and gorgeously colored cream of asparagus soup is easy to make for a delicious way to celebrate the first tender spears of the season.

Photos For me, asparagus is one of those rare vegetables that shines brightest when enjoyed in soup form. Here's an ultra-easy and gorgeously colored cream of asparagus soup recipe. By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich — aka Chef John — has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes. He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on March 26, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 16 16 16 16 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 tablespoons butter 1 onion, finely diced salt to taste 4 cups chicken broth 2 cups water 2 pounds fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste (Optional) freshly ground black pepper to taste 1 pinch ground nutmeg ½ cup heavy whipping cream (Optional) Cream Topping: ¼ cup heavy whipping cream 1 tablespoon freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese 1 teaspoon lemon zest 1 pinch cayenne pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck To make the asparagus soup: Melt butter in a soup pot over medium heat. Add minced onion and salt; cook and stir until onion is soft and golden, about 10 minutes. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Pour chicken broth and water into the pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium, and simmer 15 minutes. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Carefully add asparagus pieces into simmering broth. Cook, stirring occasionally until asparagus is just tender and still bright green, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Use an immersion blender to blend soup until smooth, about 3 minutes. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Turn heat to low. Season with cayenne pepper, black pepper, and nutmeg. Adjust salt to taste. Whisk 1/2 cup cream into soup. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck If you want to make a cream topping for garnishing: Place 1/4 cup cream, Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, and lemon zest in a small bowl. Whisk until frothy and slightly thickened, about 1 minute. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Ladle soup into bowls. Drizzle a spoonful of prepared cream on top of each serving and swirl to form a random design. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Sprinkle with a pinch of lemon zest and cayenne pepper, if desired. Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Enjoy! Allrecipes / Julia Hartbeck Chef's Note For a finer texture, strain soup through a mesh strainer after blending. Return strained soup to the pot to warm through before adding lemon cream topping. I Made It Print 126 home cooks made it!
